alert.note: Alert for Anderson (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 19 at 7:21PM EDT until June 19 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following county, Anderson. * WHEN...Until 115 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 720 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Nuisance to Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen in less than an hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. Due to training nature of these thunderstorms, significant rainfall is possible and flash flooding may occur. This Flood Advisory may be upgraded to a Flash Flood Warning. Please stay weather aware and away from all streams and adjacent low-lying areas. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Anderson, Easley, Clemson, West Greenville, Welcome, Homeland Park, Powdersville, Piedmont, Belton, Williamston, Northlake, Pendleton, Reed Creek, West Pelzer, Anderson Airport, Lake Hartwell, Sandy Springs, Townville, Sadlers Creek State Park and Fair Play.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
